definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: I am sailing against waves and squalls on the rough icy sea.
sentences.chinese: 迎着风浪，冒着沉没的危险，我在冰海中艰难地航行。

sentences.english: Don't let love disappear in dumbness.
Successive Japanese governments have refused to take responsibility for the sinking of the AHS Centaur.
sentences.chinese: 日本历届政府都拒绝承担责任的沉没的翰凯半人马。

sentences.english: It is a fictionalized account of the sinking of the RMS Titanic.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部根据RMS泰坦尼克号沉没改编的小说。

sentences.english: I counted four battleships definitely sunk, three severely damaged.
sentences.chinese: 我数了一数，有四艘主力舰无疑已经沉没，三艘重创。

sentences.english: The story of the " unsinkable " luxury liner Titanic has fascinated people for nearly a century.
sentences.chinese: 人们对永不沉没的泰坦尼克号豪华轮着迷近一个世纪。

sentences.english: Is the vessel in any immediate danger of sinking or capsizing ?
sentences.chinese: 船是否有趋于沉没或倾覆的危险。

sentences.english: Every man stayed at his post; and, by their great courage, they managed to save the ship from sinking.
sentences.chinese: 大家都坚守岗位，终于以极大的勇力使船沉没。

sentences.english: Fiftyfive flags freely flutter from the floating frigate.
sentences.chinese: 五十五面旗子在微微沉没的战舰上自在的飘荡。

sentences.english: That extended period of time is the sandbar that sinks ships.
sentences.chinese: 这种过分估值的时期就是让船沉没的沙洲。

sentences.english: After the ship sank, salvage of its argon was impossible.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没以后，想打捞出其氩气是不可能的。

sentences.english: The cost in their time is a sunk cost.
sentences.chinese: 他们的时间成本是一种沉没的成本。

sentences.english: Economies of Scale and Scope, Sunk Costs, Barriers to Entry and Unbundled Network Elements.
sentences.chinese: 经济规模，沉没成本，进入障碍以及非绑定网路元素。

sentences.english: So, the mystery of the Victory's last resting place had been solved.
sentences.chinese: 因此，胜利号最后沉没之地的谜底就被解开了。

sentences.english: I am the waylaid pieces of history which sank out of sight in all of our pasts.
sentences.chinese: 我是所有我们过去中，沉没在视线外的历史遗骸。

definition: (of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
(of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
to fall into the ocean/to crash into the ocean
